data: „Sprawdź się w praktyce. Zagraniczny staż pierwszym krokiem do zawodowej kariery”.

The project „Test your skills. International apprenticeship as a first step to your career” is addressed to the students of The First Private School of Hospitality in Zamosc and The School of Craftsmen in Zamosc. The project is addressed to students of catering and hospitality from 1st to 4th year of studies, and outlines the participation of 34 students in a 3 week apprenticeship in The United Kingdom and Germany.
KTZ Sp. z o.o. wants to enable the participants acquire professional and language competences as well as gain first professional experience in modern companies abroad. The realization of these key objectives is the main goal of the enterprise, which is compatible with large projects investing in tourism in Zamosc region. The project „Test your skills. International apprenticeship as a first step to your career” can complete such projects because it prepares the students to work with international customers. 

The objectives of the Project are as follows: 
- Developing key competences and professional skills,
- Improving language skills within the profession, and its practical use,
- Gaining first professional experience,
- Increasing the opportunities of future employees to find their first job,
- Developing the field of European education and improving the clarity of qualifications,
- Improving students’ self- esteem,
- Introducing innovative elements to vocational education,
- Establishing cooperation with educational institutions and companies

KTZ Sp. z o.o. assumes that implementation of the project will be highly beneficial both for the participants and institutions which take part.

The expected results of students’ participation in the project:
- Better knowledge of foreign language within profession,
- Mastery of new professional skills depending on the profession and relevant to the programme of apprenticeship,
- Acquiring knowledge of European job markets and the opportunities for employment,
- Acquring first professional experience,
- Improving participants’ self-esteem and developing abilities to work in team, especially internatonal,
- Increasing the motivation to learn foreign languages,
- Learning the rules applied in modern catering and hospitality companies,
- Receiving first certificates to confirm professional qualifications,
- The opportunity for students to prepare to their practical exams in an innovative form

*The impact on the sending company:
- establishing cooperation with partners from abroad, resulting in creating a competent educational center, teaching according to latest European standards,
- acquiring competence to prepare students to work in an international environment,
- creating mechanisms and procedures  to support students in the field of modern catering and hospitality education,
- making the educational possibilities more appealing through offering apprenticeships abroad 

*The impact on host companies:
- gaining experience of implementing projects in cooperation with partners from Poland,
- getting familiar with the quality of vocational education in Poland,
- improving international communication competence,
 

*The project will also have impact on the following target audience:
- parents will not have to cover any costs, all the costs involved are covered by Erasmus+ programme, 
- Zamosc region will gain employees with unique qualifications and knowledge,
- junior high (gimnazjum) students will have the opportunity to learn about the benefits of this project and consider them as an incentive to choose a school which implements such projects 

The following people will Take part in implementation of the project: project coordinator,  assistant coordinator, accountant, the group monitors appointed by sending company, tutor appointed by receiving companies, vocational subjects teachers, form tutors at school.

Promoting results will progress in multiple directions. KTZ Sp. z o.o. intends to promote the project and its results among:
*students of schools run by KTZ,
*students of junior high (gimnazjum) in Zamosc region,
*vocational subject teachers,
*parents,
*local community,
*companies operating in tourism,

*On national and international level: through partners’ websites, press articles, social networking websites
Marie Skłodowska-Curie actions — generating, developing and transferring new skills, knowledge and innovation (15.03.01.01)
Marie Skłodowska-Curie actions — generating, developing and transferring new skills, knowledge and innovation (15.03.01.01)

ACER VETPRO4 will continue a series of mobility project which enable colleges from the East of England to build links with European partners to enhance professional development and share expertise.  This project builds upon previous  projects which comprised 11 visits by 60 VET Lecturers to Denmark, Netherlands, Spain, Czech Republic, Finland and Sweden, Lithuania, Cyprus, Portugal and Finland. The lecturers and managers representing 11 ACER colleges were drawn from specialisms including Construction, Motor Vehicle, Electronics, Agriculture, ICT, and Business Studies, Health and Social Care, Hospitality and Catering, Travel and Tourism and Leisure and Sport. The participants also explored to what extent the host country has matched its National Qualification Framework against the EQF and implemented the ECVET system. Resulting from these visits, networks, partnerships and two-way exchanges of staff and learners have already been established. 



This mobilities project will contribute to both individual continuous professional development (CPD) plans as well as continuing to develop long term strategic partnerships between Est of England Colleges and EU VET providers. Individuals will have the opportunity to widen their knowledge and expertise, including experience of different teaching and learning methodologies, innovations in technology and learning and diverse cultures to help to adapt training courses to meet employers changing skills needs.  All participants will engage in learning the basic language of the host country. Participants are concentrating on the organisation of and preparation for Apprenticeships and Entrepreneurship and Learner guidance and support during the visits.



This project will specifically focus on arranging mobilities for 60  East of England college staff- providing them with the opportunity to explore the organisation and management of:

apprenticeship schemes, 

innovative mathematics teaching, 

use of skills competitions

working with young people not in education, employment or training (NEET) 



in the host countries. Within this we will look to learn more about how the host utilise the supportive involvement of employers and business support agencies. 



In the short term we envisage that participating managers and practitioners will learn new ways of delivering vocational training which address the above priorities, as well as sharing their own experiences with the EU VET counterparts. 



In the longer term we envisage that participating colleges will come to see this activity as an essential component of their staff's professional development programme (as has already begun to be the case with some of our colleges). More strategic/longer term  impacts will be as colleges continue and develop the visits and relationships to form longer term strategic partnerships with their European hosts through which further collaborative working/projects can be developed. This is something we have seen already evolve from previous ACER managed mobilities projects which have resulted in colleges developing their own partnership projects with hosts from previous visits.
Association of Colleges in the Eastern Region
Demonstration of ATM Improvements Generated by Initial Trajectory Sharing- Airspace User Part

'*  DIGITS-AU is the essential Airspace User complement to the DIGITS project (Demonstration of ATM Improvements Generated by Initial Trajectory Sharing). DIGITS was granted under H2020-SESAR-2015-2, SESAR.ID-VLD.Wave1-27-2015, and its continuation is dependent on the participation of Airspace Users (AU).
*  As required, DIGITS-AU brings together Airspace Users
- who operate (even partially) in the airspace of ANSPs participating to DIGITS, namely DFS, ENAV, MUAC and NATS and 
- who will receive through this Call new onboard avionics capability which allows to downlink trajectory predictions, the so-called Extended Projected Profile (EPP), for sharing with Air Traffic Control.
*  This proposal addresses also the interface with other SESAR 2020 projects, by nature with PJ31 DIGITS, but also with PJs 01, 09, 10 and 18 in order to contribute to the identification of benefit potentials facilitated by this new airborne technology. The capture of real fuel burn reduction for DIGITS-AU flights is not possible due to the fact that ground ATC systems are used in an pre-operational or shadow mode, based on which air traffic controllers may not alter their instructions. Nevertheless 'what-if' cases shall be identified as far as observations possibly allow and the theoretical fuel burn gain calculated.'
